name: B-Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and we were very happy. The room was good size, the pool area is lovely. The location is excellant and the bus from the airpost drops you right by hotel. The only negative is that the hotel describtion says 'well-equipped gym' but thay was no gym at the hotel. We had a fab time in Barcelona and would love to go back to this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: stayed here for 6 days and 6 nights with my girlfriend. perfect location for town, its only 5 minutes by metro to the main shopping area and you can use the green or red metro lines from Espanya, 200 metres from the hotel (turn right out of hotel). couldn't comment on breakfast but used the local supermarket down the road, about 2 minutes walk (turn left out of the hotel) and there you can get fresh bread, croissants, etc. looks like a bookshop/newsagent but sells allsorts inside.
reviews.title: great hotel, great location

reviews.text: lights...don't know quite what the fuss is about, they are pretty straight forward. the main problem we had was locating the button for the blind between the bathroom and the bedroom (switch is part of shaver socket over the sink).
reviews.title: Great value Top Notch Hotel

reviews.text: great view, friendly staff. great rooftop. internet access via computer in main foyer for those of us without laptops (who takes a laptop on holiday? we're not all business men!).
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel and good value for money

reviews.text: watch the funky ceiling lights in the lift as they change colour and as you move up the corridors to your room the lights brighten and dim.
reviews.title: A god choice

reviews.text: We stayed here a couple of nights in June and as we wanted something different (and a pool was important for us) we choose B-hotel at a very reasonable rate (90€ per room per night), knowing that hotels in Barcelona are often over-priced in the high season and that you can only get a shabby pension for 60-70€ per night it's worth it paying the extra for far better quality.
reviews.title: A nice 'different' hotel in Barcelona !

reviews.text: The rooms were nice, spacious, very contemporary with lcd tv, 'open' bathroom and domotica. Very well cleaned and with a nice atmosphere to them. Friendly reception staff.

reviews.text: The pool (with panoramic views) was a big bonus to cool down after hours of sightseeing.

reviews.text: I loved the hotel for several aspects. The first one and without a doubt the pool in the roof, with a view toward the Madrid square, a good place to make love. then second the room a simple but fine room, with a bathroom very fashion with a bathtub view to the bed....the personnel is simple and nice.

B-Hotel is a great place on many levels. Firstly the design is very funky and stylish. I loved the bar area, rooms and the front door (once we'd found it!). The pool on the roof is a great plus and fab for just chilling out.
reviews.title: Cool hotel in an amazing city

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is great, being on Placa Espanya which has a rail and tube station. A walk over the road and you have easy access to the parks of Montjuic.

The rooms themselves are funky with the light switch situation creating much amusement. I felt that it did seem a little rough in places as the wooden floor scratches easily but over all it is well built.

reviews.title: Alright if you are not fussy

likes.disliked: — Location plus "trying hard but not quiet getting it feeling"

reviews.text: Would definitely stay here again if I came back to barcelona.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Staff Issues

reviews.text: Stayed 23rd January. Room on 7th Floor - very stylish, lots of nice touches, quality fittings. Hotel is fabulous - staff were polite, friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was good, lots of choice and typical of Barcelona hotels. Despite being very close to Place D'Espanya the room was very quiet. I travel to Barcelona frequently and like to be away from the Ramblas area because it is so noisy. B is about 20 minute walk from Place Catalunya but is yards from Metro. For €1.20 you can travel to Catalunya in 10 minutes. Also taxis are very cheap although most taxi drivers speak no English. Hotel were having problems with hot water supply but this was out of their control ~ problem locally with water supply on that day. I can't recommend this hotel enough.
reviews.title: Excellent
Great hotel, but noisy and location a bit off
reviews.text: Great hotel, cool rooms and great service. Staff was relaxed and very nice to deal with.

reviews.title: Funky hotel in a funky city
reviews.text: Ask for a corner room as they are slightly larger. Rooms facing the street slightly noisy in the morning rush. Breakfast buffe not that good, and location a bit off perhaps. Taxis are cheap and easy to come by though so did not matter much.

reviews.title: Honeymooned Here
reviews.text: Alright, this was the 2nd stay of our honeymoon (the 1st was Rome), and we were very pleased with everything about this hotel. The hotel staff was excellent. They spoke good English and pointed us out in every direction- The nightlife, tourist attractions, romantic spots and everything. The location of the hotel is excellent. The metro is about a 5 min walk. The metro is very convenient to get to anywhere in the city. I would advise on your 1st day in Spain to take the guided bus tour and figure out which sites you like and then visit them accordingly the following days.

The Hotel Room was very nice and elegant. The lighting of the room was awesome (a little hard to figure out). You could dim the lights and could make for a very eventful night. There is FREE internet service in the hotel, so no need for a laptop.
reviews.title: Second rate hotel with rude staff

reviews.text: Overall, me and my wife have NO complaints about this hotel (and we are very particular about room standards). We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: loved the hotel b

reviews.text: Having read some of the excellent reviews that the B Hotel has on Tripadvisor my boyfriend and I decided to book seven nights with them.
reviews.title: loved it !!!!

reviews.text: When we arrived they couldn't find our booking but after ten minutes or so of looking they did. When we went to our room we found they had given us a twin room and we had booked a double. We went back to reception to explain that we had booked a double not a twin and we were told that in Spain there is no word for twin and that a "double" just means it sleeps two whether it's two single beds or one double bed. The staff member who told us this was very abrupt. We were told that getting a double room was "NOT POSSIBLE" until the next day. We were disappointed but we agreed.
reviews.title: A must for a girlie weekend!
Spot On
reviews.text: Service was absolutely fabulous. Sergio at the front desk was so friendly, helpful, and professional. Nothing was a problem for them.

reviews.title: A Grade for the B Hotel
reviews.text: We have nothing bad to say about this hotel and would stay here over and over again!!!

reviews.title: Amazing hotel!!!
reviews.text: I'd definately recommend this hotel to people wanting a bit of luxury at affordable prices. As soon as I walked into the room, the modern style reminded me of the Lowry Hotel in Manchester. The room had all modern and stylish amenities, including a digital safe, which was free to use. The plasma screen tv was a good bonus too. The rooms are quiet, and if you prefer to have the balcony doors shut at night, no traffic noise can be heard. The location is ideal, I got the aerobus from El Prat which drops you off on Placa Espanya and its only a short walk to the hotel. Montjuic, MNAC, the Olympic Stadiums and Poble Espanyol are about a 20-25 minute walk away (Depending on how fast you walk!) and the views of the city from the steps of MNAC and from the Olympic Stadium are amazing, especially on a clear day. There is easy access to Placa Catalunya from the bus stop accross the road from the hotel, which has buses running very often. The supermarket down the street is also very convenient with cheap food, especially if you're on a budget ;) I'd definately go back to Barcelona again (for the 4th time!), and to this hotel especially ;)

reviews.title: Brilliant value hotel in a central location.
reviews.text: Where to start. This hotel is of a VERY high standard for the money. The thing that stops it getting higher star rating is the absence of a restaurant. This is how the Star-rating system works. No restaurant means it can't get any higher. We stayed for 5 nights, in October - after the end of the main tourist season really. The room was great. Clean, crisp and modern. The double bed was two single's wedged together, but it was HUGE and hardly noticeable. The bath was lovely, although it took us 10 minutes to find the tap! (Modern fixtures!) The only slight 'quirk' was that the wall between the bed and the bath/shower was glass. No curtain or anything. So whether you wanted to or not, you got to watch your roommate soaping themselves! Fine if you're a couple, but if you're away sharing and on business or just friends, you might not be so keen! I'm guessing twin rooms must have a different arrangement.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before you book this hotel, you need to ask yourself what you want. If you want a hotel that has lots of bars, restauraunts and shops within easy walking distance, then this is not the hotel for you. If however you want a hotel that is close to the metro and therefore easy to get anywhere is barcelona quickly then this could be for you. But way up the pros and cons.

reviews.title: As good as it sounds
A place really worth staying!
reviews.text: This hotel is a design hotel first and foremost so what you will see everywhere are touches of minimalism and bespoke design pieces matched with your trademark design hotel mood lighting.
Check-in was efficient and we were racing up to our room in no time at all. At this juncture I feel it necessary to point out that there are two categories of room.
reviews.title: Just wonderfull...just B-Hotel...
Cool Barcelona hotel
reviews.text: The first is your standard room which encompasses a king, queen or two twins together bed (important to specify upon booking) with a modern bath/shower, fun/complicated mood lighting, 20" LCD television with limited channels and floor to ceiling windows spanning the width of the room with a half metre deep balcony in front. When booking, specify that you would like a room facing the Plaza Espana as the room are very well sound insulated with aircon so worrying about leaving the balcony door open is not an issue and you can wake up to a marvellous yet buzzing view.

reviews.title: Excellent Value for money
reviews.text: What can I say about this hotel that hasn't already been said?! I booked it on the recommendation of a friend of a friend and wasn't dissapointed with it.

reviews.title: A Special Recommendation!!!
reviews.text: As soon as we'd pulled up in the taxi outside the hotel my girlfriend and I were lost for words, even more so when we got to our room. We stayed on the executive (7th) floor and had a nice little balcony, amazing lighting and furniture and a great view of Gran Via.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently went to Barcelona for the first time with my girlftriend and we stayed at the B-Hotel and had an absolutely amazing time. This hotel is extremely chic and in a great location for those who prefer not to stay too close to the madness of the Ramblas. It is very close to the Magic Fountain which has an amazing light and music show in the evenings. Getting to the Ramblas, the beach and the marina is extremely easy as there is a Metro station and a bus stop incredibly nearby and Spanish public transport is fast, clean, very cheap and air conditioned.
reviews.title: Great discovery.

likes.liked: — Roof top pool and deck area

reviews.text: The hotel itself is beautifully designed and has an amazing roof top deck with sun loungers, complete with an infinity pool, which is a great place to chill out after a day's sightseeing or before heading off at night. The rooms themselves are great too and have excellent bathrooms although the lighting takes some getting used to! Our only criticism would be the awful overpriced breakfasts. Guests would do better to walk around the corner to Paul's the upmarket bakers and buy some top notch pastries instead.
reviews.title: Superb hotel, great location

reviews.text: Incidentally, we'd heard that Barcelona could be dangerous with lot's of muggings but we felt quite safe strolling through the town at midnight.
reviews.title: Great, modern hotel with perfect location

reviews.text: Finally, this hotel appeals to couples of all sexual persuasions but is not suitable for families, as it lacks child friendly facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was with a party of 6 girls, celebrating a big birthday. The hotel was perfect for this. Lovely terrace with pool, and the friendly staff on hand with beers for us! I booked directly with the hotel and got a very good price. I would recommend staying here as you are minutes away from the Metro and the stop for the tour bus, which I would thoroughly recommend. I didn't have breakfast in the hotel as it was 13 euros, but there were plenty of restaurants on the main street. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Adult Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a long weekend at the B Hotel. Very impressed with the modern design. Staff were excellent when asked about local facilities ie shopping, bars and restaurants. Breakfast was the best continental buffet I have had anywhere. A good walk to main centre, but enjoyable. The best feature was the rooftop pool and terrace area. The second best was the design of the bathroom. Thoroughly recommended!
reviews.title: Stylish B Hotel
Fantastic Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: I just returned from a four night weekend break at the B Hotel in Barcelona and was delighted with the hotel. The rooms are typical boutique style with everything you could want - fantastic mood lighting, block-out curtains and ample storage - with superb bathroom - the shower was one of the best I have had, and the range of products provided extensive, including decent hairdryer! In contrast to other reviewers I did not find the window wall to the bathroom a problem as there was a ceiling to floor blind maintaining some privacy. Although the rooms are sound proofed, the main road outside is noisy and you can hear traffic at night. The pool is breathtaking - an infinity pool on the roof with lots of loungers and cushioned chairs. There is also internet access in the lobby which seems to be very popular, and wifi in the rooms if you have your own laptop. Reception very helpful for restaurant bookings in the city. Would highly recommend this hotel for singles, couples and families - great value for the price you pay.

Stayed here 3 nights on my first barcelona visit. It is one of the best designed hotel i have ever seen. Rooms,bathroom,terrace,bathroom amenities, everything was unique.Rooftop view was spectacular at night, however the swimming pool was way too small for a hotel with 80 rooms.
reviews.title: Great design, poor staff

reviews.text: Breakfast had a lot of choices, there were tapas, light food, cookies,pastries, all kinds of fruit juices and drinks. Plus, it was served till 11 oclock, which was good for late sleepers.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

reviews.text: Other than all the good things, hotel staff didnt really speak english, and the ones who spoke answered me back in Spanish. It is such a shame cos there were many american tourists at the hotel.Last day, i needed to use the so-called `business center` and it was a total dissapointment.First, the printer wasnt installed on the hotel computer so i had to bring my own laptop, and connect the printer.And then there were only a few sheets of paper in the printer and one side of them were already used,but they were turned back to the clean side,so when i tried to print a document, it was successfully printed on the used side of the papers. I am sure it is not so difficult for a hotel that charges the customers minimum 150Euros for a night to supply clean and unused papers and properly working computers for business center.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although it is slightly out of the city centre we found it a great location. It is easily accessible from the airport by the airport bus right outside the terminal. They will drop you at Plac Espanya and the hotel is right there. When you want to head into the city centre there is a metro station just across the road from the hotel. We found this the easiest way to get around and were in the city centre within 10 minutes of leaving the hotel. Within 10 minutes walk of the hotel is the hill of Montjuc and the Font Magic which are worth a look on weekend evenings when the fountains are set to music. Also next to this is Mies Van Der Rohe's Barcelona Pavillion, a mecca for architecture buffs. We carried on walking up the hill, helped by a series of very welcome outdoor escalators and after a half hours stroll with some beautifull views of the city, we were at the Joan Miro Museum. Carry on from here and you can get the Fununcular railway back to the metro system.
reviews.title: B for Brilliant

The room was generously sized and faced the back so was nice and quiet. Referring to the comment two doors down about the missing bathroom door, this is a design feature of the room. There is no door between the bath and the bedroom, there is a black glass wall. There is a door for the toilet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a 6th floor room facing Grand Via. It is a very busy road and there was traffic noise but this is a city hotel so it's fair to expect it and it didn't bother me. If you're a light sleeper, there are some rooms on the inside of the hotel that you might want to ask for. The room is a good size with large desk, comfortable chair and sofa. There is a full length door and tiny balcony that you can step out on for a bit of fresh air. Bathroom is good with a decent sized bath and seriously powerful shower which amazingly doesn't go all over the floor like most do.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

description: B-Hotel is the one of the best places to stay while visiting Barcelona. Less than ten minutes from the Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya, the beach, and the museums atop Montjuïc, its location within the most exciting area of the city and its proximity to the major conference centers have made B-Hotel a favorite destination for travelers on business or pleasure, as well as a key gathering spot or meeting place.
